name: Death Is The End
description:
A game made in less than 48 hours for Ludum Dare 50

The theme is "Delay The Inevitable."

In this game, you play through the life of a man who continually encounters the grim reaper. Formulate arguments as to why he shouldn't take you away by matching blocks. Be careful, though; not all matches are good. Unlike most block matching games, there isn't always a way to clear the board.

Features:

  • A story with multiple endings
  • Two difficulty modes
  • Four levels, each with slightly different mechanics
  • As much polish as I could muster in 48 hours.

Instructions:

  • Press "Space" to advance dialogue.
  • Press "A" to move left and "D" to move right.
  • Press "W" to rotate.
  • Press "S" to speed up the fall.
  • Press "[Redacted]" to automatically win.
  • Press "[Redacted]" to automatically lose.

Credits:

Featuring gameplay, code, art, and music by HiImWren

Featuring fonts by "Who Knows, They're All Default."

The gameplay is inspired by "Lumines."

The story is inspired by "That One Episode of Supernatural."

Art inspired by "A Lack of Sleep, and Too Much Caffeine."

This is a work of fiction. Any similarity to actual persons, living or dead, or actual events is purely coincidental.
